intro: Skeptrostachys berroana, commonly known as the Bolivian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in cyathia. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
